wikipedia_page.main: Leslie Howard Talbot Cliff (5 June 1908 – 2 August 1969) was a British pair skater who competed with his wife, Violet Cliff.  The couple finished seventh at the 1936 Winter Olympics.  That same year, they won the silver medal at the European Figure Skating Championships and the bronze at the World Figure Skating Championships.  They won another bronze at the 1937 World Championships.

link_mentions.page: Great Britain at the 1936 Winter Olympics
Figure skating at the 1936 Winter Olympics – Pairs

response: Violet Hamilton Cliff (née Supple) (2 November 1916 – 23 March 2003) was a British pair skater who competed with her husband, Leslie Cliff.  The couple finished seventh at the 1936 Winter Olympics.  That same year, they won the silver medal at the European Figure Skating Championships and the bronze at the World Figure Skating Championships.  They won another bronze at the 1937 World Championships. She was born in Bath, Somerset, England.
